job.title: Financial Manager
job.description:
A global services company is searching for a Financial Manager for one of their divisions in the East Rand.

Job Description:

The candidate will be responsible for the Financial Management function, including but not limited to the following:

  • Overseeing the full accounting function for the division.
  • Monthly management reports.
  • Presenting the financial reports to top management.
  • Provide commentary to enable top management to make strategic business decisions.
  • Management of staff.

Minimum Requirements:

  • BCom degree
  • Around 5 years experience.
  • Excellent presentation skills.

Benefits are negotiable.

Thank you for submitting your CV. We will assess your suitability for the existing vacancies and retain your CV in our database in accordance with the Protection of Personal Information Policy. We will contact you should your CV be suitable for any available positions. You have the right to "Opt-Out" of electronic communications from us at any time and you also have the right to request us to delete your information by sending a request to

job.title: Human Resource/Employee Relations Management Professional
job.description:
Skills and experience required (Non-negotiable):

  • 10 years of HRM work experience in SA
  • Labour Relations: Grievance, Disciplinary, CCMA, Performance Improvement & reviews
  • Compliance: Employment Equity, COID, UIF, IRP5 recons
  • Membership: Employment Equity, MANCO, Training Committee
  • B-BBEE: Tenders, Strategy implementation, Employment Equity Targets, Empowering Supplier targets, Headcounts, HR docs for B-BBEE audit, Policies, Job Grading, Employment Equity Policy
  • Occupational Health, Safety and Quality: EHS and Quality (audits), Quality document control, IOD
  • Policies / Templates: HR legal register, Manage policies as per Law/company, Draft new policies as per Law/company
  • Local Talent Development: Local high-end talent retention, etc.
  • Outsourcing company management: General Management of PSL, meeting & reviews with HRBPs

Qualifications Required:

  • Degree in HR Management

Responsibilities:

  • Work with HRD as the senior partner for local affairs
  • Training & development of staff on labour relations
  • Staff welfare
  • Assist with corporate visa applications
  • Present at Employees Orientation Programmes
  • Manage Top Employer survey

job.title: PMO Lead
job.description:
The Role:

We are looking for an experienced PMO Lead for a 12-month fixed term contract for our client in Mpumalanga.

Â 

We are looking for your 10 years work experience within heavy industry, mining and production environment.

Â 

We are looking for your Project Management experience in applying Lean methodology in a project management environment.

Â 

Minimum educational level: Â  Â  Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 

  • BEng Engineering
  • Government Certificate of Competence: Engineering
  • Certificate Project Management
  • Lean Six Sigma Black Belt
Skills and Experience:

Purpose of the role:

  • Establish and operationalise a Project Management Office (PMO) function, with a key focus on driving the PMO function and continuous improvement initiatives.
  • Manage continuous improvement reporting, develop and implement robust processes, manage the overall governance and tracking of projects.Â 
  • To direct and manage project development for duration of projects phases.
  • To develop project plans and estimate resources needed to achieve project goals through the implementation of Lean principles.
  • Engage with Stakeholders.
  • The PMO Lead is the functional leader of project delivery and governance across the projects. Provide advice and guidance, monitoring and assurance, advocacy and education with respect to programmes, projects, and their delivery, at all levels.
  • Reporting framework focussed on value added advice and early identification of risk and issues for all major programmes and projects across the organisation.
  • Support identification of improvement areas and solution development.

Â 

Technical skills:

  • Coordinate site operations readiness team interfacing with the project to ensure the delivery of key project milestones. This includes ensuring critical milestones are met, providing visual management on progress and problem solving with the work stream teams to mitigate risks or project delays.
  • Create and execute project work plans and revise to meet changing project needs and requirements.
  • Creating action plans to manage risk to the operations.
  • Ensure document control via centralised capturing system specified.
  • Implement controls to ensure legal compliance.
  • Apply controls to ensure legal and best practice compliance in accordance with MHSA (Mine Health and Safety Act), MPRDA (Mineral and Petroleum Resources Development Act), OHSA (Occupational Health and Safety Act) where applicable
  • Implement effective SHE management systems for project.
  • Adhere to Enterprise Project Management (EPM) Standards and requirements of quality management systems.
  • Ensure compliance to environmental Record of Decision (RoD).
  • Manage and ensure optimal use of budget allocated to project.
  • Advise on selection of project recovery team members.
  • Report on the optimization and improvement projects to the mega project manager to ensure targets and initiatives are met.
  • Provide inputs for planning and recommendations for staff to be efficiently deployed and identify areas of further development (projects and training).
Key Accountabilities:

We require your 10 Yearsâ?? work experience with the following Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Audit projects and programmes for project progress against agreed tolerances
  • Audit Project support offices to ensure adhere to Corporate Governance with regards to processes, systems, guidelines and templates
  • Update knowledge of project management best practice
  • Participate in evaluation of discipline-specific standards, principles and practice to enable planning, design and implementation of project outcomes that support business strategy
  • Contribute to development and implementation of an appropriate approach to knowledge management for discipline in line with business needs
  • Provide and participate in governance systems for best practice
  • Keep abreast with developments in Lean principles
  • Create working relationships with project managers and other Project Management Offices (PMO)
  • Identify resources needed and assigns individual responsibilities
  • Take action to mitigate and manage risks that can impact on project
  • Identify and manage project dependencies and critical path
  • Supervise and ensure execution of projects in adherence to agreed SLA''s and service delivery standards
  • Work directly with the work stream leads to develop detailed robust operational readiness plans are developed by each function to ensure they are aligned and integrated across the site and with the project and provide regular visibility on progress.
  • Create an environment of right first time in everything that we do through a focus on principles of lean including simplification, standard work, visual management and a learning organisation as part of the establishment of the site PMO
  • Be accountable for a robust investigation process to drive to right first time
  • Ensure Regional Project Support Office (RPSO) conduct periodic audits on projects responsibility
  • Represent the PMO office at appropriate conferences, seminars and other events
  • Maintain and ensure healthy environment, safe operations and practices, ensuring compliance with all applicable SHE policies and procedures in line with set standards
  • Encourage culture that focuses on safety in all operations

need to build web pages, websites, create UI, make the website simple and attractive.Ã‚Â Your primary focus will be on developing user interface components and implementing them following well-known React.js workflows (such as Flux or Redux) along with CSS3 and HTML5.

job.title: Graphics Software Engineer
job.description:
Job Description


Responsible for developing multiple aspects of graphics software, display driver development and simulation environment development. Works with various partners to enhance and improve graphics performance on upcoming processor graphics devices by analyzing performance issues in software drivers and applications, implementing software performance improvements, and recommending future hardware & software improvements. Also responsible for providing internal and external feedback to implement upcoming graphics features in yet-to-be-released OSes to ensure our hardware and software will function and perform as expected on next generation platforms as well as designing/developing/implementing graphics system-level software for future platforms.



Qualifications

Master or Bachelor of Engineering degree in Electronics or Computer Engineering with 2 to 6 years of experience. Should have good understanding of Computer architecture(IA), micro controller/microprocessor, device driver (preferably graphic driver), windows components. Ability to understand and interpret graphics & display driver requirements. Should be self-motivated and should have open mindset to change & should be able to multitask effectively. A self-starter with the ability to work effectively both independently and in a team across multiple Geos. Excellent analytical ability, problem solving and communication skills (verbal and written). Should have right attitude to work with Intelâ€™s customers/OEMs (Japan, China, Taiwan etc.). Hands on experience using windbg and windows debugging tools would be added advantage. Experience in customer support and system level understanding would be added advantage. Good understanding of Display graphics driver / Media / 3D /Audio would be added advantage. Familiarity with agile methodologies like Scrum or Kanban will be added advantage.

job.title: Senior Associate, Solution Engineering (DevOps)
job.description:
Senior Associate, Solution Engineering (DevOps)

IND - Pune

Senior Associate, Solution Engineering â€“ Pune, India
Want to do work on a massively global scale with a fintech company that is poised to revolutionize the industry?Â Come join our growing team and help shape our companyâ€™s digital capabilities and revolutionize an industry! Join Western Union as Senior Associate, Solution Engineering.

Motivated by our values: purpose driven, globally minded, and trustworthy & respectful
Weâ€™re a FinTech thatâ€™s using insight from customers and colleagues worldwide to improve financial services for families, small businesses, multinational corporations, and non-profit organizations. Weâ€™re a team of over 10,000 people spanning 200 countries and territories. We believe when money moves, better things happen.

Better requires process discipline and simplification

You will create, manage, and own automation tools and scripts, configuration management of platform technologies. Your focus will be to monitor continuous integration build systems and proactively debug issues working closely with the development and support teams. You will be involved in planning the deployment in conjunction with change management, configuration management, and knowledge management processes in the organization.

For this role, you will come with a Bachelorâ€™s degree and 7+ years of experience in software engineering with extensive experience in Build & Release management for applications hosted in On-prem and Cloud environments. You should know Core Java and have hands-on experience working with DevOps tools - Git/Gitlab, Jenkins, Gradle, Rundeck, Ansible, Redhat Linux configuration, and management. You will also have experience with Repository Management (Archiva, JFrog), Containers (Docker, Kubernetes, AWS Fargate), RDBMS (DB2, MySQL) which is mandatory, NoSQL (Couchbase) will be preferred. AWS certification will be a plus for this role.

Join us, and let us move money for better

Western Union is transforming its business and shaping the financial services sector by driving quality, convenience, and customer service to new levels of excellence. Itâ€™s an exciting time for our organization, as the largest cross-border money transfer operator, trusted by millions of consumers around the world. If youâ€™re ready to unleash your potential to help drive change through bottom-up innovation, apply now.

Weâ€™re a company on the move, and we want our people to grow and develop. Youâ€™ll have plenty of opportunities to learn new skills and build a career, as well as a great salary and benefits package.

We are passionate about our diversity. Our commitment is to provide an inclusive culture that celebrates the unique backgrounds and perspectives of our global teams, while reflecting the communities we serve. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, political affiliation, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, marital status, or veteran status.

breaks things.-Maintain code and write automated tests to ensure the product is of the highest quality.-Transition existing React web apps to React NativeDesired Candidate Profile:-Firm grasp of the
